intro: Conophytum ectypum subsp. cruciatum, commonly known as the cross-leaf conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that form a rosette shape. The leaves are typically green with a reddish tinge and have a textured surface. It produces small, yellow flowers during the winter months, which are followed by distinctive, triangular seed pods. This plant is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
